p.s: William Shakespeare's sonnet No. 65 was written about 1806 and is about transcience of beauty and nature within the time.
The sonnet has the typical structure, this consists of three quatrains and a rhyming couplet.
Each quatrain has a cross rhyme and the sonnet is written in lines of iambic pentameter.
Sonnet 65 is part of the first segment of Shakespeare's sonnets, which is known as the Fair Youth sonnets.
The poet dotsdotes on an attractive young man and assures that his beauty will everlast through the sonnets words no matter if he ages or eventually dies.
The first quatrain is about the question how beauty is able to withstand decay when even nature cannot.
The second quatrain deals with the paradoxyparadox of the strenghstrength of rocks and steel which decays within the time.
The third quatrain is questionaing if hiding beauty is a solution to protect it from transciencetransience.
In the final couplet there is a turning point, this the solution of preserving the Fair Youth's beauty throughout the words of the sonnet seems effective.
